posts.content: Looking to go to France next year, have you been to any decent camp sites that you could recommend?
ANY of the Municipal sites. They sound a bit pikey, ie council run sites... BUT they're great. Loads cheaper than commercial run sites, and every one we stayed at was clean, friendly, safe etc. etc.

Choc wrote:
Looking to go to France next year, have you been to any decent camp sites that you could recommend?


Tis a big place Choccy - we went to the Vendee region (atlantic coast ) this summer. Really easy drive + great activities (surfing, fishing, cycling etc)

Went to Argeles (South East France on the border with Spain) previous year. Took 3 days to drive down and stayed in some great sites.

Give us a bit more of a clue eh

Yep Camping municipal are the ones to look for as theryre usualy not in the middle of nowhere and easilt walking distance from bars E.T.C,
So far have only found one crap site in France. Would be realy handy if i could remember where it was

57aircooled wrote:
where abouts are you thinking ?


Perhaps within 4 hours drive of Calais?

4hrs mmmm

we go twice a year
half summer term little france
summer hols big france
this is where we went last year little france about 1.5 hr from calais :
http://www.camping-lesaubepines.com/
had a fantastic time
youll need bikes though 1m to village
kids loved it
this is our summer for 3 yrs now
and next allready booked 7.5hrs from calais
http://www.campinglekervastard.com/

this is one special place
i can post pics if needed
nothing VW related , just a fantastic village with beaches
all around , just like the med

we are looking to go here http://www.yellohvillage.com/en/panoram ... 036_8.html next summer is there anyway i can
avoid that bloody big bridge (Normandy Bridge) i think its called scares the hell outta me , any help kindly appreciated
